step_data.thought: Looking at the current state of the page and the URL (http://127.0.0.1:7780/admin/sales/order/), I can see that I'm already on the Orders page. The page shows customer orders, including one with ID '000000002' for customer 'Veronica Costello'. The page has a table listing orders with columns for ID, Purchase Point, Purchase Date, Bill-to Name, Ship-to Name, Grand Total, Status, Customer Name, Action, and Allocated sources. There's also a search box, filters, and various management options. Since the goal was to navigate to the Orders page to view all customer orders, and we're already on that page with the orders visible, I've successfully completed the task. I should inform the user that we've reached the Orders page and can see the customer orders.
step_data.action: stop('I have successfully navigated to the Orders page. You can now view all customer orders. Currently, there is 1 order visible from customer Veronica Costello with order ID 000000002 and status Closed. The page provides various options to manage orders, including filtering, searching, and exporting order data.')
